The Template Class


The Template class in QueFlowJS provides a way to create and manage reusable templates for your web application. This class simplifies the process of dynamically rendering HTML content based on provided data.


Syntax: Template(
selector : string | node,
 stylesheet : object, 
templateFunc : function | string)


Creating a Template

To create a Template instance, you need to provide the following:

  1. selector: A string selector or a DOM element representing the target where the template will be rendered.
  2. stylesheet: An object containing CSS styles that will be scoped to the template's element.
  3. templateFunc: A function that returns the HTML string for the template. This function can optionally accept data as an argument to dynamically generate the HTML.


Template.renderWith() Method

           Syntax: Template.renderWith(data : object, position : string)

The renderWith() method is used to render a Template based on it's parameters. This method takes the following arguments:

  1. data: An object containing the data to be used for template rendering.
  2. position: (Optional) A string specifying the rendering position i.e "append" (default), "prepend".

Using Data in Templates

The templateFunc can optionally accept data as an argument to dynamically generate the HTML. This data can be used within the HTML string returned by the function using string interpolation or other techniques.






In summary, The Template class in QueFlowJS provides a powerful tool for creating and managing reusable templates within your web application. It allows you to easily render dynamic content based on data and apply styles scoped to the template element.
